hints.content:
Let's break up or group the values to try to get the same addends in each expression. 

If there are no leftovers, the expressions are equal.

###Cameron's strategy

Cameron adds $340 + 294$.

$\begin{align}
\text{original expression}&\stackrel{?}{=}\text{Cameron's expression}\\\\
\blueE{341} + \purpleD{293}&\stackrel?={340} + {294}\\\\
\blueE{341} + \purpleD{293}&\stackrel?=\blueE{340 + 1} +\purpleD{293}\\\\
\blueE{341} + \purpleD{293}&\stackrel{\checkmark}{=}  \blueE{341} + \purpleD{293}
\end{align}$

Yes, Cameron's result is *equal to* $341 + 293$.

###Aniyah's strategy

Aniyah adds $348 + 300$.

$\begin{align}
\text{original expression}&\stackrel{?}{=}\text{Aniyah's expression}\\\\
\blueE{341} + \maroonD{293}&\stackrel?={348} + {300}\\\\
\blueE{341} + \maroonD{293}&\stackrel?=\blueE{341} + {7} + \maroonD{293} + {7}\\\\
\blueE{341} + \maroonD{293}&\stackrel?=\blueE{341} + \maroonD{293} + {7} + {7}\\\\
\blueE{341} + \maroonD{293}&\neq \blueE{341} + \maroonD{293} + {14}
\end{align}$

Aniyah's expression has an extra $14$.

So, Aniyah's result is *greater than* $341 + 293$.
Only Cameron's result is equal to $341 + 293$.

question.content:
Cameron and Aniyah are trying to add $341 + 293$.

Cameron adds $340 + 294$.

Aniyah adds $348 + 300$.

**Whose result is equal to $341 + 293$?**
